page.title: 02STEWARTBY BRICK WORKS
page.content:
"Brickmaking is one of the oldest crafts in the civilised world, so old indeed that the origin of brick is lost in antiquity...." Most of London Brick Company factories are on the belt of Oxford clay which stretches across England from Yorkshire to Dorset. LBC operates nine works in Buckinghamshire, Bedfordshire and Cambridgeshire. Stewartby is the largest of these works making 12.5 million of the 36 million bricks a week.
Brickmaking can be broken down into five major parts: 1 Winning: raw material, clay or shale is extracted from surface pits and taken to the factories. 2 Processing: brick shaping is done by cutting and by pressing or hand-moulding. To add character to
